Below I add to Kris's comments.

Kristinn Sigurdsson wrote:

> You can debug your classes under eclipse with no problem in Eclipse. 
> Just run (debug mode) Heritrix via Eclipse and make sure you have some 
> break points.
>
>  
>
Here is the section of the manual that talks of eclipse integration: 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual.html#eclipse.  You 
must set the system property heritrix.development as in 
'-Dheritrix.development' so heritrix looks for webapps in their 
development locations.

>
> I want to write a  xxxWriterProcessor to replace
> ARCWriterProcessor ,Because I want to filter the web pages .
> thanks
>
I'd suggest you first develop your writer standalone using the class 
main method or better, create a sister JUnit class that exercises your 
new writer.  Try integrating only after you have it working standalone.

Integration is not as easy as it could be.  Its kinda awkward putting 
another writer in place of writer currently -- you have to replace all 
of ARCWriterProcessor.  Would be sweeter if you could just replace 
ARCWriter and pick up on the pooling facility of ARCWriterProcessor.  I 
was thinking of refactoring putting in place a factory that could be 
configured with the writer to instantiate.

Yours,
St.Ack
